basic.subject: Math
basic.shortDescription: You’ll stretch your numerical, algebraic and algorithmic problem solving skills as you try to rescue the lovable Wuzzits from the cages by rotating the cogs in the gears mechanism.  One reviewer described this engaging game as Angry Birds meets Lumosity.
basic.description: You’ll stretch your numerical, algebraic and algorithmic problem solving skills as you try to rescue the lovable Wuzzits from the cages by rotating the cogs in the gears mechanism.  One reviewer described this engaging game as Angry Birds meets Lumosity.

wo1.name: No negative rotate
wo1.description: This is the fifth puzzle that requires a negative rotation. Confirm student has realized the gear can be rotated counter-clockwise and understands how to count backwards to solve puzzles.

wo2.name: No multi-rotate
wo2.description: This is the tenth puzzle that requires multi-rotation. Confirm student has realized the gear can be rotated in a multiplicative fashion and understands how to use multiplication to solve puzzles more efficiently.

wo3.name: No strategy
wo3.description: The student has not shown signs of the strategic thinking required to obtain a multi-step solution. The more advanced puzzles in this room (and all later puzzles) require algebraic and algorithmic thinking.

wo4.name: No combinations
wo4.description: The player seems unable to decompose an integer into a sum of two multiples. This is a crucial skill for algebra.

so5.name: Strategy
so5.description: Player has exhibited good strategic thinking.

so6.name: Two cogs
so6.description: Player has demonstrated the ability to decompose an integer into a sum of two multiples.

so7.name: Better solution
so7.description: Player has solved the problem in fewer moves than the target threshold. This shows considerable creative mathematical thinking ability.
